gurmukhi: ਦੋੳੂ ਖੰਡ ਖੰਡੀ ਦੋੳੂ ਮੰਡ ਮੰਡੰ ||
translation: Both were the destroyers of the enemies with their double-edged swords and were also their establishers.

gurmukhi: ਦੋੳੂ ਚਿਤ੍ਰ ਜੋਤੀ ਸੁ ਜੋਧਾ ਪ੍ਰਚੰਡੰ ||
translation: Both were Glory-incarnate and mighty heroes.
Both were intoxicate elephants and like king Vikrama.

gurmukhi: ਦੋੳੂ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਬੇਤਾ ਦੋੳੂ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਪਾਨੰ ||੧੧||੨੨੯||
transliteration: Dooo Sastra Betaa Dooo Sastra Paanan||11||229||
translation: Both were adepts in warfare and had weapons in their hands.11.229.
Both were Supreme warriors full of rage.

gurmukhi: ਦੋੳੂ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਬੇਤਾ ਦੋੳੂ ਰੂਪ ਖਾਨੰ ||
transliteration: Dooo Sastra Betaa Dooo Roop Khaanan||
translation: Both were adepts in warfare and were the source of beauty.

gurmukhi: ਦੋੳੂ ਛਤ੍ਰ ਪਾਲੰ ਦੋੳੂ ਛਤ੍ਰ ਧਰਮੰ ||
transliteration: Dooo Chhatra Paalan Dooo Chhatra Dharamannd||
translation: Both were Sustainers of Kshatriyas and followed the discipline of Kshatriyas.

transliteration: Dooo Juddh Jodhaa Dooo Kroor Karamannd||12||230||
translation: Both were the heroes of war and men of violent actions.12.230.
Both were standing and fighting in enclosures.

gurmukhi: ਹਥੈ ਹਰ ਦੁ ਠੋਕੈ ਭੁਜਾ ਪਾੲਿ ਗਾਜੈ ||
transliteration: Hathai Hard U Thokai Bhujaa Paae Gadjai||
translation: Both struck their arms with their hands and shouted loudly.

gurmukhi: ਦੋੳੂ ਖੱਤ੍ਰ ਹਾਣੰ ਦੋੳੂ ਖਤ੍ਰੰ ਖੰਡੰ ||
transliteration: Dooo Khattra Haanan Dooo Khatran Khanndan||
translation: Both had Kshatriya discipline but both were the destroyers of Kshatriyas.

transliteration: Dooo Khagg Paanan Dooo Chhetra Mandan||13||231||
translation: Both had swords in their hands and both were the adornments of th battlefield.13.231.

gurmukhi: ਦੋੳੂ ਚਿਤ੍ਰ ਜੋਤੀ ਦੋੳੂ ਚਾਰ ਬਿਚਾਰੰ ||
translation: Both were Beauty-incarnate and had lofty thoughts.
Both were operating their double-adged swords in their enclosures.
